api_list.name: Gettime
api_list.description: Retrieve the server time. This endpoint is also useful as a method for a client to 'ping' the Stronghold Platform and measure latency.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/utilities/time"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/utilities/time"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Listmarkets
api_list.description: Retrieve a list of the well known markets on the venue.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/string/markets"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/{venueid}/markets"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Getassets
api_list.description:
Retrieve a list of known assets for the current venue.

## Response

Field | Type | Description
--- | --- | ---
Result | Asset[] | List of known assets for the current venue.

api_list.name: Getmarketorderbook
api_list.description:
Retrieve the orderbook for a given market.

## Response

Field | Type | Description
--- | --- | ---
result | Orderbook | The market orderbook.
result.bids | string[][] | The bid orders.
result.asks | string[][] | The ask orders.

Each item in the bids or asks arrays is an array describing a particular price with a size: ["(price)", "(size)"].
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/string/markets/string/orderbook"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/{venueid}/markets/{marketid}/orderbook"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Listmarkettrades
api_list.description:
Retrieve a list of historic trades for a given market. The last 200 trades are provided by default. If your use case requires more history, please contact developers@stronghold.co

## Response

Field | Type | Description
--- | --- | ---
result | Object | The latest historic trades.
result.marketId | string | The market's identifier.
result.trades | string[][] | The trades.

Each item in the trades array is an array describing a particular trade: ["(price)", "(size)", "(time)"].
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/string/markets/string/trades"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/{venueid}/markets/{marketid}/trades"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Getaccount
api_list.description:
Retrieve account information, including balances.

The result will contain the following information:
- **ID**: the account's identifier. Stronghold associates a protocol-agnostic identifier that is used in preference to the 'native' ID, such as a 'public address'.
- **Balances**: the account's balances. Asset information will be provided where possible.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/string/accounts/string"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues/{venueid}/accounts/{accountid}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Getavailablevenues
api_list.description:
Retrieve the venues the credential has access to.

Each venue describes its:
- **capabilities**: as each venue differs in protocol and context, not all Platform APIs are supported on all venues. The capabilities object describes which operations can be performed.
- **attributes**: protocol/context-specific key-value pairs.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com/venues"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "testingapiwithinorg.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
